name: Leming Shi
title: Professor
college: Human Phenome Institue & School of Life Sciences
intro:
Dr. Leming Shi is a professor at the School of Life Sciences and Shanghai Cancer Center of Fudan 
University. Dr. Shi's research aims to improve the success rate of drug discovery and development 
and to promote precision medicine by generating, analyzing and integrating high-quality multi-omics
data. Dr. Shi conceived and led the MicroArray and Sequencing Quality Control (MAQC/SEQC) 
consortia. These efforts led to the development of multiple FDA guidance documents and the 
launch of the International MAQC Society (www.maqcsociety.org) to enhance the reproducibility of 
high-throughput technologies. Dr. Shi was a co-founder of Chipscreen Biosciences where he 
co-developed a chemogenomics-based drug discovery platform, leading to the marketing approvals
of one novel HDAC inhibitor (Chidamide) for treating cancers and one novel PPARα/γ/δ pan-agonist
(Chiglitazar) for treating type 2 diabetes. Dr. Shi and his collaborators developed a multi-omics-based
approach for molecular subtyping and precision treatment of breast cancers (Cancer 
Cell 2019, Nature Genetics 2023, Nature Cancer 2024). Dr. Shi's team recently developed the first 
suite of certified multi-omics reference materials (chinese-quartet.org), facilitating the development
of a ratio-based multi-omics quantification approach that is inherently more resistant to 
batch effects (Nature Biotechnology 2024a,b). Dr. Shi has published over 200 papers and (co-)led 
the development of four ISO and CLSI standards and guidance on genomics.

name: Yuanting Zheng
title: Associate Professor
college: Human Phenome Institue & School of Life Sciences
intro: Dr. Yuanting Zheng obtained her PhD in pharmacology from China Pharmaceutical University and is an associate professor at the School of Life Sciences and Human Phenome Institute of Fudan University. She is the president of the China chapter of the international Massive Analysis and Quality Control (MAQC) Society. Her research focuses on reference materials for multiomics quality control, aiming to translate multiomics technologies into clinical companion diagnosis and for empowering the discovery of novel drug targets and therapeutics.

name: Ying Yu
title: Associate Research Fellow
intro: Dr. Ying Yu Engaged in bioinformatics, big data, and precision medicine research, with many years of experience in tumor genomics and pharmacogenomics research. Proficient in big data mining and software development, and as a core member, developed the PreMedKB precision medicine knowledge base system for interpreting clinical personal genome data. Possesses a strong biological background, is proactive, and has a spirit of teamwork, communication skills, and research writing experience. Principal investigator of one National Natural Science Foundation of China Youth Fund project and involved in six national-level research projects, including the National Key R&D Program of China Precision Medicine Initiative and the National Natural Science Foundation of China Key International Cooperation Project. Published 22 related SCI academic papers in journals such as Nature Communications, Genome Biology, and Nature Biotechnology, with over 600 SCI citations.

name: Yaqing Liu
title: Research Assistant
intro: I received my Bachelor of Bioinformatics from Tongji University (2015-2019) and my Master of Biotechnology Engineering from Fudan University (2019-2022) under the supervision of Prof. Leming Shi. My primary research interests focus on quality control and standardization in multi-omics studies, dedicated to advancing innovative research discoveries in omics technologies and ensuring their high-quality translation and application. As the (co-)first author, I have published eight peer-reviewed papers in prestigious journals such as Nature Biotechnology (2 papers), Nature Communications, and Genome Biology. Additionally, I have actively participated in several national research projects and contributed to drafting international, national and industry standards.

works.institution: China chapter of the international Massive Analysis and Quality Control (MAQC) Society

name: Chao Zhang
title: Research Assistant
intro: My primary responsibilities include transcriptome analysis, project data management, data quality control, and the development of standard pipelines.

name: Qingwang Chen
title: PhD Candidate (2020-)
intro: I am passionate about leveraging cutting-edge bioinformatics tools to analyze large-scale transcriptomic data and explore its applications in disease research.

name: Ruolan Zhang
title: PhD Candidate (2020-)
intro: Precision typing and individualized treatment of glioma for clinical transformation and application.

name: Zehui Cao
title: PhD Candidate (2020-)
intro: My research interests focus on multi-omics and pharmacogenomic studies in metabolic diseases aiming to reveal disease mechanism and realize precision medicine.

name: Qiaochu Chen
title: PhD Candidate (2021-)
intro:
I have been studying on batch effect diagnosis and correction of proteomic and metabolomic data to improve their quality. Using universal Quartet reference materials, a ratio-based method was validated to be effective in correcting batch effect in multi-omics data. Currently, I am carrying on the comparative study on that at which data level (peptide/protein) to correct batch effect in MS-based proteomics. For my bachelor’s dissertation, I have developed protqc, an R
package for the performance assessment of proteomics data based on Quartet reference materials, which is now available at Quartet data portal (https://chinese-quartet.org/#/dashboard).

name: He Jiang
title: PhD Candidate (2022-)
intro: I focus on using multi-omics to discover alterations relevant to cancer development,  predictive biomarkers and therapeutic targets. I hope to translate novel findings from cancer research into clinical practice, in order to improve clinical management of patients.

educations.school: Tianjin University of Science and Technology

educations.degree: MSc in Biomedical and Biochemical Science

name: Yuanbang Mai
title: PhD Candidate (2022-)
intro: Data science enthusiast. Experienced Research Assistant with a demonstrated history of working in biostatistics. Solid background in statistics. Master of Science degree in Hong Kong Baptist University, focused on Data Mining.
interests: Biostatistisc,Data Mining, Data Intergration, Quality control

educations.school: Hong Kong Baptist University Beijing Normal University United International College

educations.degree: MSc in Operation Research and Business Statistics

works.institution: Guangzhou Institutes of Biomedicine and Health Chinese Academy of Sciences
Greater Bay Area Institute of Precision Medicine

name: Jiaqi Li
title: PhD Candidate (2023-)
intro: Driven by a deep enthusiasm for pharmaceutical R&D and equipped with an interdisciplinary background, my focus lies in validating potential drug targets identified through multi-omics analysis by constructing cellular and murine models. My work aims to improve therapeutic options for patients.

name: Shumeng Duan
title: PhD Candidate (2023-)
intro: A bioinformatics enthusiast dedicated to improving the quality of multi-omics data through the use of standard substances.

name: Yuyang Zhu
title: PhD Candidate (2024-)
intro: Interested in the discovery and development of innovative drugs，with the help of reliable multi-omics data.

name: Yanming Xie
title: PhD Candidate (2024-)
intro: My research ambition is to improve data quality in the field of sequencing and explore best practices from materials to analytical methods. I hope my work will help generate more high-quality and meaningful data in the field, supporting clinical practice.

name: Zhiyin An
title: PhD Candidate (2024-)
intro: With a medical and pharmaceutical background, I am interested in the translation of available biological data into clinical drugs to improve the patient outcomes. Cancer is a kind of heterogenous disease with high mortalities and neoantigen vaccines were proved effective for the treatment of cancers. I aim to find potential neoantigen targets to guide the design of therapeutic cancer vaccines.

name: Gui Yao
title: MSc Candidate (2022-)
intro: I am deeply passionate about learning and committed to making every moment count by acquiring knowledge. My keen interest in data analysis drives my enthusiasm for uncovering insights and patterns. I am particularly drawn to the field of precision medicine, where I see the potential to revolutionize healthcare through personalized approaches. My dedication to continuous learning fuels my ambition to contribute meaningfully in this dynamic intersection of data and healthcare.

educations.school: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

name: Haonan Chen
title: MSc Candidate (2023-)
intro: My primary research interests lie in the development of AI-based bioinformatics algorithms for multi-omics data and their application to precision medicine. Currently, I am focused on investigating the predictability of diabetes therapeutic outcomes and identifying their biomarkers using a diverse range of multi-omics datasets and machine learning algorithms.

name: Leqing Sang
title: MSc Candidate (2023-)
intro: My research interests focus on developing bioinformatics tools for precision oncology, including the interpretation of the oncogenicity and clinical significance of mutations and personalized medication.
